info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 10:50PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Litchfield County through 1115 PM EDT... At 1050 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Winsted, or near Torrington, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Torrington, New Hartford, Winsted, New Hartford Center, Barkhamsted, Colebrook, Mooreville, Nepaug, Riverton, Mill Brook, Beech Rock, Robertsville, Goose Green, Pleasant Valley, Puddle Town, Newfield, Pine Meadow, Grantville, Burrville and Drakeville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
